___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___data.description: An object describing the data source

$eref.description: Unit spec that can have a composite mark.

___background.description:
CSS color property to use as the background of visualization.

__Default value:__ none (transparent)

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

___autoResize.description: Resize is a boolean indicating if autosize layout should be re-calculated on every update.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___padding.description:
The default visualization padding, in pixels, from the edge of the visualization canvas to the data rectangle. This can be a single number or an object with `"top"`, `"left"`, `"right"`, `"bottom"` properties.

__Default value__: `5`

___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___data.description: An object describing the data source

___field.description: The data field to apply time unit.

___timeUnit.description: The timeUnit.

___as.description: The output field to write the timeUnit value.

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___parse.description: A collection of parsing instructions can be used to define the data types of string-valued attributes in the JSON file. Each instruction is a name-value pair, where the name is the name of the attribute, and the value is the desired data type (one of `"number"`, `"boolean"` or `"date"`). For example, `"parse": {"modified_on": "date"}` parses the `modified_on` field in each input record a Date value. Specific date formats can be provided (e.g., `{foo: 'date:"%m%d%Y"'}`), using the [d3-time-format syntax](https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format). UTC date format parsing is supported similarly (e.g., `{foo: 'utc:"%m%d%Y"'}`). See more about [UTC time](timeunit.html#utc)

___mesh.description:
The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to mesh.
Similar to the `feature` option, `mesh` extracts a named TopoJSON object set.
  Unlike the `feature` option, the corresponding geo data is returned as a single, unified mesh instance, not as individual GeoJSON features.
Extracting a mesh is useful for more efficiently drawing borders or other geographic elements that you do not need to associate with specific regions such as individual countries, states or counties.

___property.description:
(JSON only) The JSON property containing the desired data.
This parameter can be used when the loaded JSON file may have surrounding structure or meta-data.
For example `"property": "values.features"` is equivalent to retrieving `json.values.features`
from the loaded JSON object.

___feature.description:
The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to a GeoJSON feature collection.
For example, in a map of the world, there may be an object set named `"countries"`.
Using the feature property, we can extract this set and generate a GeoJSON feature object for each country.

___format.description: Parsing properties.

___values.description: Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

___encoding.description: A key-value mapping between encoding channels and definition of fields.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___mark.description:
A string describing the mark type (one of `"bar"`, `"circle"`, `"square"`, `"tick"`, `"line"`,
`"area"`, `"point"`, `"rule"`, and `"text"`) or a [mark definition object](mark.html#mark-def).

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___selection.description: A key-value mapping between selection names and definitions.

___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___data.description: An object describing the data source

_88CompositeUnitSpec.description: Unit spec that can have a composite mark.

___field.description:
__Required.__ Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

__Note:__ `field` is not required if `aggregate` is `count`.

___timeUnit.description:
Time unit for a `temporal` field  (e.g., `year`, `yearmonth`, `month`, `hour`).

__Default value:__ `undefined` (None)

___bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object
for binning parameters.

$eref.description: Binning properties or boolean flag for determining whether to bin data or not.

___divide.description:
Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

__Default value:__ `[5, 2]`

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description:
The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

__Default value:__ `10`

___step.description:
An exact step size to use between bins.

__Note:__ If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___extent.description: A two-element (`[min, max]`) array indicating the range of desired bin values.

___nice.description: If true (the default), attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.

___maxbins.description:
Maximum number of bins.

__Default value:__ `6` for `row`, `column` and `shape` channels; `10` for other channels

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___aggregate.description:
Aggregation function for the field
(e.g., `mean`, `sum`, `median`, `min`, `max`, `count`).

__Default value:__ `undefined` (None)

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___titleAlign.description: Horizontal text alignment of axis titles.

___labelColor.description: The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___titleColor.description: Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___labelPadding.description: Padding in pixels between axis ticks and tick labels.

___bandPosition.description: An interpolation fraction indicating where, for `band` scales, axis ticks should be positioned. A value of `0` places ticks at the left edge of their bands. A value of `0.5` places ticks in the middle of their bands.

___gridDash.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.

___labelFont.description: The font of the tick label.

___tickColor.description: The color of the axis's tick.

___tickSize.description:
The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `tickSize` (`6` by default).

___labels.description:
A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis (default true).

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `labels` (`true` by default).

___tickWidth.description: The width, in pixels, of ticks.

___gridOpacity.description:
The stroke opacity of grid (value between [0,1])

__Default value:__ (`1` by default)

___titleFontSize.description:
Font size of the title.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___labelAngle.description:
The rotation angle of the axis labels.

__Default value:__ `-45` for time or ordinal axis and `0` otherwise.

___tickRound.description: Boolean flag indicating if pixel position values should be rounded to the nearest integer.

___titlePadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.

___titleY.description: Y-coordinate of the axis title relative to the axis group.

___titleAngle.description: Angle in degrees of axis titles.

___domainWidth.description:
Stroke width of axis domain line

__Default value:__  (none, using Vega default).

___tickExtra.description: Boolean flag indicating if an extra axis tick should be added for the initial position of the axis. This flag is useful for styling axes for `band` scales such that ticks are placed on band boundaries rather in the middle of a band. Use in conjunction with `"bandPostion": 1` and an axis `"padding"` value of `0`.

___domain.description: A boolean flag indicating if the domain (the axis baseline) should be included as part of the axis (default true).

___labelFontSize.description:
The font size of the label, in pixels.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___titleBaseline.description: Vertical text baseline for axis titles.

___domainColor.description:
Color of axis domain line.

__Default value:__  (none, using Vega default).

___titleLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.

___titleX.description: X-coordinate of the axis title relative to the axis group.

___labelLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.

___grid.description:
A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axis

__Default value:__ `true` for (1) quantitative fields that are not binned and (2) time fields;  otherwise, `"false"`.

___maxExtent.description: The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.

___ticks.description: Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.

___minExtent.description: The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.

___titleMaxLength.description:
Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

__Default value:__  automatically determined based on the cell size (`config.cell.width`, `config.cell.height`)

___groupby.description: The data fields to group by. If not specified, a single group containing all data objects will be used.

___summarize.description: Array of objects that contains aggregate information for the transform.

___field.description: The data field for which to compute aggregate function.

___as.description: The output field names to use for each aggregated field.

___aggregate.description: The aggregation operations to apply to the fields, such as sum, average or count. See the aggregate operation reference for more.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

Use in conjunction with `"bandPostion": 1` and an axis `"padding"` value of `0`.

___domain.description: A boolean flag indicating if the domain (the axis baseline) should be included as part of the axis (default true).

___labelFontSize.description:
The font size of the label, in pixels.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___titleBaseline.description: Vertical text baseline for axis titles.

___domainColor.description:
Color of axis domain line.

__Default value:__  (none, using Vega default).

___titleLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.

___titleX.description: X-coordinate of the axis title relative to the axis group.

___labelLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.

___grid.description:
A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axis

__Default value:__ `true` for (1) quantitative fields that are not binned and (2) time fields;  otherwise, `"false"`.

___maxExtent.description: The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.

___ticks.description: Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.

___minExtent.description: The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.

___titleMaxLength.description:
Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

__Default value:__  automatically determined based on the cell size (`config.cell.width`, `config.cell.height`)

___axisBand.description: Specific axis config for axes with "band" scales.

___area.description: Type of overlay for area mark (line or linepoint)

___line.description:
Whether to overlay line with point.

__Default value:__ `false`

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___timeFormat.description:
Default datetime format for axis and legend labels. The format can be set directly on each axis and legend. [D3 time format pattern](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Time-Formatting)).

__Default value:__ `'%b %d, %Y'`.

__Default value:__ `'Number of Records'`.

___background.description:
CSS color property to use as the background of visualization.

__Default value:__ none (transparent)

___maxStrokeWidth.description:
Default max strokeWidth for strokeWidth  (or rule/line's size) scale.

__Default value:__ `4`

___minBandSize.description:
The default min value for mapping quantitative fields to bar and tick's size/bandSize scale with zero=false
If undefined (default), we will use the `continuousBandSize` value for bar and 3 for ticks.

___maxSize.description: Default max value for point size scale.

___useUnaggregatedDomain.description:
Use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis.
This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain (`"mean"`, `"average"`, `"median"`, `"q1"`, `"q3"`, `"min"`, `"max"`). For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain (e.g. `"count"`, `"sum"`), this property is ignored.

___minFontSize.description:
The default min value for mapping quantitative fields to tick's size/fontSize scale with zero=false

__Default value:__ `8`

___minOpacity.description:
Default minimum opacity for mapping a field to opacity.

__Default value:__ `0.3`

___minStrokeWidth.description:
Default minimum strokeWidth for strokeWidth (or rule/line's size) scale with zero=false.

__Default value:__ `1`

___minSize.description:
Default minimum value for point size scale with zero=false.

__Default value:__ `9`

___bandPaddingInner.description:
Default inner padding for `x` and `y` band-ordinal scales.

__Default value:__ `0.1`

___textXRangeStep.description:
Default range step for `x` ordinal scale when is mark is `text`.

__Default value:__ `90`

___bandPaddingOuter.description:
Default outer padding for `x` and `y` band-ordinal scales.
If not specified, by default, band scale's paddingOuter is paddingInner/2.

___maxBandSize.description:
The default max value for mapping quantitative fields to bar's size/bandSize.
If undefined (default), we will use bandSize - 1.

___pointPadding.description:
Default outer padding for `x` and `y` point-ordinal scales.

__Default value:__ `0.5`

___maxFontSize.description:
The default max value for mapping quantitative fields to text's size/fontSize.
If undefined (default), we will use bandSize - 1.

__Default value:__ `40`

___rangeStep.description:
Default range step for (1) `y` ordinal scale,
and (2) `x` ordinal scale when the mark is not `text`.

__Default value:__ `21`

___shapes.description:
The default collection of symbol shapes for mapping nominal fields to shapes of point marks (i.e., range of a `shape` scale).
Each value should be one of: `"circle"`, `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `["circle", "square", "cross", "diamond", "triangle-up", "triangle-down"]`

___round.description:
If true, rounds numeric output values to integers.
This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.
(Only available for `x`, `y`, `size`, `row`, and `column` scales.)

___maxOpacity.description:
Default max opacity for mapping a field to opacity.

__Default value:__ `0.8`

___clamp.description: If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

which provides 1 pixel offset between bars.

___titleAlign.description: Horizontal text alignment of axis titles.

___labelColor.description: The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___titleColor.description: Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___labelPadding.description: Padding in pixels between axis ticks and tick labels.

___bandPosition.description: An interpolation fraction indicating where, for `band` scales, axis ticks should be positioned. A value of `0` places ticks at the left edge of their bands. A value of `0.5` places ticks in the middle of their bands.

___gridDash.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.

___labelFont.description: The font of the tick label.

___tickColor.description: The color of the axis's tick.

___tickSize.description:
The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `tickSize` (`6` by default).

___labels.description:
A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis (default true).

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `labels` (`true` by default).

___tickWidth.description: The width, in pixels, of ticks.

___gridOpacity.description:
The stroke opacity of grid (value between [0,1])

__Default value:__ (`1` by default)

___titleFontSize.description:
Font size of the title.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___labelAngle.description:
The rotation angle of the axis labels.

__Default value:__ `-45` for time or ordinal axis and `0` otherwise.

___tickRound.description: Boolean flag indicating if pixel position values should be rounded to the nearest integer.

___titlePadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.

___titleY.description: Y-coordinate of the axis title relative to the axis group.

___titleAngle.description: Angle in degrees of axis titles.

___domainWidth.description:
Stroke width of axis domain line

__Default value:__  (none, using Vega default).

___tickExtra.description: Boolean flag indicating if an extra axis tick should be added for the initial position of the axis. This flag is useful for styling axes for `band` scales such that ticks are placed on band boundaries rather in the middle of a band. Use in conjunction with `"bandPostion": 1` and an axis `"padding"` value of `0`.

___domain.description: A boolean flag indicating if the domain (the axis baseline) should be included as part of the axis (default true).

___labelFontSize.description:
The font size of the label, in pixels.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___titleBaseline.description: Vertical text baseline for axis titles.

___domainColor.description:
Color of axis domain line.

__Default value:__  (none, using Vega default).

___titleLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.

___titleX.description: X-coordinate of the axis title relative to the axis group.

___labelLimit.description: Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.

___grid.description:
A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axis

__Default value:__ `true` for (1) quantitative fields that are not binned and (2) time fields;  otherwise, `"false"`.

___maxExtent.description: The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.

___ticks.description: Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.

___minExtent.description: The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.

___titleMaxLength.description:
Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

__Default value:__  automatically determined based on the cell size (`config.cell.width`, `config.cell.height`)

___axisRight.description: Specific axis config for y-axis along the right edge of the chart.

___filterInvalid.description:
Whether to filter invalid values (`null` and `NaN`) from the data.
- By default (`undefined`), only quantitative and temporal fields are filtered.
- If set to `true`, all data items with null values are filtered.
- If `false`, all data items are included. In this case, null values will be interpreted as zeroes.

_88NumberValueDef.description: Definition object for a constant value of an encoding channel.

___value.description: A constant value in visual domain.

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.
Name of the visualization for later reference.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___layer.description: Unit specs that will be layered.

___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___background.description:
CSS color property to use as the background of visualization.

__Default value:__ none (transparent)

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___layer.description: Unit specs that will be layered.

___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___data.description: An object describing the data source

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___continuousBandSize.description:
The default size of the bars on continuous scales.

__Default value:__ `2`

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___binSpacing.description:
Offset between bar for binned field.  Ideal value for this is either 0 (Preferred by statisticians) or 1 (Vega-Lite Default, D3 example style).

__Default value:__ `1`

___discreteBandSize.description:
The size of the bars.  If unspecified, the default size is  `bandSize-1`,
which provides 1 pixel offset between bars.

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___titleAlign.description: Horizontal text alignment for legend titles.

___orient.description:
The orientation of the legend. One of `"left"` or `"right"`. This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is `"right"`.

__Default value:__  `"right"`

___labelColor.description: The color of the legend label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___titleColor.description: The color of the legend title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___gradientStrokeColor.description: The color of the gradient stroke, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

___strokeWidth.description: Border stroke width for the full legend.

___titleFontWeight.description: The font weight of the legend title.

___labelFont.description: The font of the legend label.

___gradientLabelBaseline.description: Text baseline for color ramp gradient labels.

___symbolStrokeWidth.description: The width of the symbol's stroke.

___gradientStrokeWidth.description: The width of the gradient stroke, in pixels.

___offset.description:
The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

__Default value:__  `0`

___titleFont.description: The font of the legend title.

___titleFontSize.description: The font size of the legend title.

___titlePadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between title and legend.

___padding.description: The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.

___gradientHeight.description: The height of the gradient, in pixels.

___labelBaseline.description: The position of the baseline of legend label, can be top, middle or bottom.

___gradientLabelLimit.description: The maximum allowed length in pixels of color ramp gradient labels.

___strokeColor.description: Border stroke color for the full legend.

___labelFontSize.description:
The font size of legend label.

__Default value:__ `10`.

___labelAlign.description: The alignment of the legend label, can be left, middle or right.

___gradientLabelOffset.description: Vertical offset in pixels for color ramp gradient labels.

___symbolColor.description: The color of the legend symbol,

___symbolType.description: Default shape type (such as "circle") for legend symbols.

___timeUnit.description: Time unit for the field to be filtered.

___equal.description: The value that the field should be equal to.

___field.description: Field to be filtered

___timeUnit.description: time unit for the field to be filtered.

___range.description:
An array of inclusive minimum and maximum values
for a field value of a data item to be included in the filtered data.

___field.description: Field to be filtered

___timeUnit.description: time unit for the field to be filtered.

___oneOf.description:
A set of values that the `field`'s value should be a member of,
for a data item included in the filtered data.

___fields.description:
(Optional) fields in foreign data to lookup
if not specificied, the entire object is queried

___data.description: secondary data source to lookup in

___field.description:
__Required.__ Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

__Note:__ `field` is not required if `aggregate` is `count`.

___timeUnit.description:
Time unit for a `temporal` field  (e.g., `year`, `yearmonth`, `month`, `hour`).

__Default value:__ `undefined` (None)

$eref.description:
Constants and utilities for data type  
 Data type based on level of measurement

___type.description:
The encoded field's type of measurement. This can be either a full type
name (`"quantitative"`, `"temporal"`, `"ordinal"`,  and `"nominal"`)
or an initial character of the type name (`"Q"`, `"T"`, `"O"`, `"N"`).
This property is case-insensitive.

$eref.description: Headers of row / column channels for faceted plots.

___format.description:
The formatting pattern for axis labels. This is D3's [number format pattern](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Formatting) for quantitative axis and D3's [time format pattern](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Time-Formatting) for time axis.

__Default value:__  derived from [numberFormat](config.html#format) config for quantitative axis and from [timeFormat](config.html#format) config for time axis.

___title.description:
A title for the axis. Shows field name and its function by default.

__Default value:__  derived from the field's name and transformation function applied e.g, "field_name", "SUM(field_name)", "BIN(field_name)", "YEAR(field_name)".

___bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object
for binning parameters.

$eref.description: Binning properties or boolean flag for determining whether to bin data or not.

___divide.description:
Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

__Default value:__ `[5, 2]`

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description:
The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

__Default value:__ `10`

___step.description:
An exact step size to use between bins.

__Note:__ If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___extent.description: A two-element (`[min, max]`) array indicating the range of desired bin values.

___nice.description: If true (the default), attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.

___maxbins.description:
Maximum number of bins.

__Default value:__ `6` for `row`, `column` and `shape` channels; `10` for other channels

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

___aggregate.description:
Aggregation function for the field
(e.g., `mean`, `sum`, `median`, `min`, `max`, `count`).

__Default value:__ `undefined` (None)

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___layer.description: Unit specs that will be layered.

___name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

___description.description: An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

___transform.description: An array of data transformations such as filter and new field calculation.

___layer.description: Unit specs that will be layered.

___height.description:
The height of a visualization.

__Default value:__
- For y-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the height is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `height` will be the value of `rangeStep`.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the height of a single cell.

___width.description:
The width of a visualization.

__Default value:__ This will be determined by the following rules:

- For x-axis with a continuous (non-ordinal) scale, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if [`rangeStep`](scale.html#ordinal) is a numeric value (default), the width is determined by the value of `rangeStep` and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the width will be the value of [`config.cell.width`](config.html#cell-config).
- If no field is mapped to `x` channel, the `width` will be the value of [`config.scale.textXRangeStep`](size.html#default-width-and-height) for `text` mark and the value of `rangeStep` for other marks.

__Note__: For plot with `row` and `column` channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

___data.description: An object describing the data source

Otherwise, if the `rangeStep` is `"fit"`, the height will be the value of [`config.cell.height`](config.html#cell-config).

___data.description: An object describing the data source

___name.description: Color scheme that determines output color of an ordinal/sequential color scale.

_88Header.description: Headers of row / column channels for faceted plots.

___format.description:
The formatting pattern for axis labels. This is D3's [number format pattern](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Formatting) for quantitative axis and D3's [time format pattern](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Time-Formatting) for time axis.

__Default value:__  derived from [numberFormat](config.html#format) config for quantitative axis and from [timeFormat](config.html#format) config for time axis.

___title.description:
A title for the axis. Shows field name and its function by default.

__Default value:__  derived from the field's name and transformation function applied e.g, "field_name", "SUM(field_name)", "BIN(field_name)", "YEAR(field_name)".

___titleAlign.description: Horizontal text alignment for legend titles.

___orient.description:
The orientation of the legend. One of `"left"` or `"right"`. This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is `"right"`.

__Default value:__  `"right"`

___entryPadding.description: Padding (in pixels) between legend entries in a symbol legend.

___padding.description: The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.

___fillColor.description: Background fill color for the full legend.

___offset.description:
The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

__Default value:__  `0`

_88VgAxisBase.description:
Base object for Vega's Axis and Axis Config.
All of these properties are both properties of Vega's Axis and Axis Config.

___titleAlign.description: Horizontal text alignment of axis titles.

___tickSize.description:
The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `tickSize` (`6` by default).

___labels.description:
A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis (default true).

__Default value:__  derived from [axis config](config.html#axis-config)'s `labels` (`true` by default).

___labelAngle.description:
The rotation angle of the axis labels.

__Default value:__ `-45` for time or ordinal axis and `0` otherwise.

___grid.description:
A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axis

__Default value:__ `true` for (1) quantitative fields that are not binned and (2) time fields;  otherwise, `"false"`.

___titlePadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.

___maxExtent.description: The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.

___titleAngle.description: Angle in degrees of axis titles.

___ticks.description: Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.

___tickExtra.description: Boolean flag indicating if an extra axis tick should be added for the initial position of the axis. This flag is useful for styling axes for `band` scales such that ticks are placed on band boundaries rather in the middle of a band. Use in conjunction with `"bandPostion": 1` and an axis `"padding"` value of `0`.

___minExtent.description: The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.

___domain.description: A boolean flag indicating if the domain (the axis baseline) should be included as part of the axis (default true).

___titleMaxLength.description:
Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

__Default value:__  automatically determined based on the cell size (`config.cell.width`, `config.cell.height`)

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___bandSize.description:
The width of the ticks.
If this value is undefined (by default,), we use 2/3 of rangeStep by default.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.

___radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties.

___shape.description:
The default symbol shape to use. One of: `"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`, or `"triangle-down"`, or a custom SVG path.

__Default value:__ `"circle"`

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___thickness.description:
Thickness of the tick mark.

__Default value:__  `1`

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

___dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the _angle_ property.

___fill.description:
Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___baseline.description:
The vertical alignment of the text. One of `"top"`, `"middle"`, `"bottom"`.

__Default value:__ `"middle"`

___font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., `"Helvetica Neue"`).

___size.description:
The pixel area each the point/circle/square.
For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

__Default value:__ `30`

___strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

___opacity.description:
The overall opacity (value between [0,1]).

__Default value:__ `0.7` for non-aggregate plots with `point`, `tick`, `circle`, or `square` marks or layered `bar` charts and `1` otherwise.

___orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.
The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.
- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick
should be applied to x or y dimension.
- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.
- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line
if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.
For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;
therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

___align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of `"left"`, `"right"`, `"center"`.

___filled.description:
Whether the mark's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

__Default value:__ `true` for all marks except `point` and `false` for `point`.

__Applicable for:__ `bar`, `point`, `circle`, `square`, and `area` marks.

___stroke.description:
Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

__Default value:__ (None)

___theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the `x` and `y` properties. Values for `theta` follow the same convention of `arc` mark `startAngle` and `endAngle` properties: angles are measured in radians, with `0` indicating "north".

___text.description: Placeholder text if the `text` channel is not specified

___angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

___tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter (for line and area marks).

___interpolate.description:
The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:
- `"linear"`: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.
- `"linear-closed"`: close the linear segments to form a polygon.
- `"step"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-before"`: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.
- `"step-after"`: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.
- `"basis"`: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"basis-open"`: an open B-spline; may not intersect the start or end.
- `"basis-closed"`: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.
- `"cardinal"`: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.
- `"cardinal-open"`: an open Cardinal spline; may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.
- `"cardinal-closed"`: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.
- `"bundle"`: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.
- `"monotone"`: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.
